doc.title: Jefferies
doc.source_uri: 2025-08-28/2H25 Outlook Resilient Condiment Business Growth2H25 Outlook Resilient Condiment Business Growth_2025-08-28

passages.text: China (PRC) | Consumer Staples Haitian Flavouring

Haitian reported 1H25 results with sales/net profit were up \(7.6\% /13.3\%\) which imply 2Q25 results sales/net profit were up \(7\% /11.6\%\) yoy, \(1 / 3\%\) higher than our estimates & core biz (condiments) delivered \(10.6\%\) growth (vs. our \(6\%\) est). We believe the company continued to gain market share despite weak consumer demand & market competition, indicating its resilient operations and channel management advantages. Maintain Buy with new PT ofRMB48.
2Q25 sales/net profit rose \(7\% /11.6\%\) yoy to RMB6.9bn/RMB1.7bn. In detail:

Sales were driven by \(10.3\% /9.6\% /9.8\% /12.7\%\) growth in soy sauce/ sauces/ oyster sauce/ other SDC, thanks to resilient consumer demand despite a weak macro environment. By region, sales increased by \(12.8\% /11.3\% /10.5\% /10.8\% /6\%\) yoy in East/ South/ Central/ North/ West China. Gross margin improved by 3.9ppts, mainly due to lower raw material costs, i.e. soybean, PET, sugar, etc, and also a favorable shift in category mix. SG&A expense ratio went up by 0.9ppt, with \(0.3 / 0.4\) ppt increase in selling expense/ G&A expense ratios. Interim div of RMB0.26/share, i.e. \(38.8\%\) payout (vs. zero interim div in 1H24).

2H25 outlook: We expect its condiment business to continue growing in 2H, both in the ToC and ToB channels. Its large- pack products offer good value- for- money to catering companies, while the rising chain rate would cause chain brands to focus more on condiment quality & consistency. The company aims to seize opportunities in restaurants located in different regions/with different taste profiles to drive the ToB business further, as ToB still accounts for \(\sim 60\%\) of total consumption volume. The ToC channel is also a point of focus, and the company plans for more product innovation to cater to the rising health consciousness trend. Overseas revenue is still limited, but the company intends continue investing in this to prepare for the longer term.

Maintain Buy with new PT of RMB48. We revise up our 2025- 27E NP forecasts by \(1 - 3\%\) to factor in better gross margin outlook. We also update EPS to reflect the H- share dual listing. We expect Haitian to continue gaining market share with solid channel mgmt. and effective A&P investments. Maintain Buy rating with a new PT of RMB48, implying \(38 / 35 / 32x\) 2025/26/27E PE.
Please see analyst certifications, important disclosure information, and information regarding the status of non-US analysts on pages 6 - 11 of this report. \\* Jefferies Hong Kong Limited

- Haitian is the leading condiment company in China. We believe it has one of the best management teams in the consumer space - well-motivated, experienced, and highly disciplined.- Haitian has competitive advantages over smaller players in cost control, branding, and channel.- We forecast 8.2% sales and 11.4% earnings CAGR for 2024-27E.- We expect market demand to gradually recover, but the core mission for Haitian is reform and channel inventory management.
Risk/Reward - 12 Month View
- Sales/net profit CAGR of 8.2%/11.4% in 2024-2027E- Price target of RMB48 based on DCF.
- Faster-than-expected recovery in catering channel.- Sales CAGR accelerates to 14% in 2024-2027E, with higher operating margin expansion.- Price target of RMB54 based on DCF.
- Prolonged weak consumption and downgrade.- Sales CAGR decelerates to 4% in 2024-2027E, with smaller-than-expected margin improvement.- Price target of RMB28 based on DCF.

Top Material Issue(s): 1) Food safety. Food safety is the basis of food consumption. Maintaining product quality and safety is crucial for Haitian, as food products are sold directly to consumers. Quality control is needed, and potential negative events such as product recalls can harm the brand images. Haitian has an online monitoring system for each of its product line to ensure safety and quality and set strict quality standards during its production. 2) There are more initiatives on environmental issues, including reducing carbon emission and sustainable packaging. Haitian has invested in several energy- saving and technology upgrade projects to promote green manufacturing.

Company Target(s): 1) Providing consumers with healthy, safe, and quality food products. 2) Execute green production and apply energy- saving technology to production and equipment upgrades to protect the environment.

Qs to Mgmt: 1) Plan to set a mid- to long timeline for environment management issues? What are the obstacles? 2) On food safety, what has changed along the supply chain to ensure suppliers comply with the company's standard?
- Earnings release- Price hikes- Updates on new product launches- M&A

We would like to thank Zhaochen Zhang, employee of Evaluerserve Inc., for providing research support services to our preparation of this report.

Headquartered in Guangdong, Foshan Haitian is the largest condiment manufacturer in China by sales. The company was established in 1955 by merging 25 soy sauce factories, but its history can be traced to the Qing Dynasty, Qianlong period (over 300 years ago). The company's major products include soy sauce, oyster sauce, sauces, vinegar, chicken essence, and cooking wine. The company was listed on the Shanghai Stock Exchange in 2014.

We value Haitian based on a fundamental DCF approach. We factor in a \(3.9\%\) risk- free rate, \(5.6\%\) equity premium, \(0.7x\) beta, \(0\%\) target D/DE, and terminal growth rate of \(2\%\) . We use a lower beta to reflect Haitian's higher risk resistance as the leader in the condiment sector. Key upside risks: faster- than- expected recovery in catering channel; price hike; and lower- than- expected input cost. Key downside risks: intensified market competition leading to market share loss and deteriorated margins; higher- than- expected input cost; and food safety issues.
(Article 3(1)e and Article 7 of MAR) Recommendation Published Recommendation Distributed

Buy - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of \(15\%\) or more within a 12- month period. Hold - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of plus \(15\%\) or minus \(10\%\) within a 12- month period. Underperform - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of minus \(10\%\) or less within a 12- month period. The expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) for Buy rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) is \(20\%\) or more within a 12- month period as these companies are typically more volatile than the overall stock market. For Hold rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) , the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is plus or minus \(20\%\) within a 12- month period. For Underperform rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) , the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is minus \(20\%\) or less within a 12- month period.
NR - The investment rating and price target have been temporarily suspended. Such suspensions are in compliance with applicable regulations and/or Jefferies policies.
CS - Coverage Suspended. Jefferies has suspended coverage of this company. NC - Not covered. Jefferies does not cover this company.

Restricted - Describes issuers where, in conjunction with Jefferies engagement in certain transactions, company policy or applicable securities regulations prohibit certain types of communications, including investment recommendations. Monitor - Describes securities whose company fundamentals and financials are being monitored, and for which no financial projections or opinions on the investment merits of the company are provided.

Jefferies methodology for assigning ratings may include the following: market capitalization, maturity, growth/value, volatility and expected total return over the next 12 months. The price targets are based on several methodologies, which may include, but are not restricted to, analyses of market risk, growth rate, revenue stream, discounted cash flow (DCF), EBITDA, EPS, cash flow (CF), free cash flow (FCF), EV/EBITDA, P/E, PE/growth, P/CF, P/FCF, premium (discount)/average group EV/EBITDA, premium (discount)/average group P/E, sum of the parts, net asset value, dividend returns, and return on equity (ROE) over the next 12 months.

Jefferies Franchise Picks include stock selections from among the best stock ideas from our equity analysts over a 12 month period. Stock selection is based on fundamental analysis and may take into account other factors such as analyst conviction, differentiated analysis, a favorable risk/reward ratio and investment themes that Jefferies analysts are recommending. Jefferies Franchise Picks will include only Buy rated stocks and the number can vary depending on analyst recommendations for inclusion. Stocks will be added as new opportunities arise and removed when the reason for inclusion changes, the stock has met its desired return, if it is no longer rated Buy and/or if it triggers a stop loss. Stocks having 120 day volatility in the bottom quartile of S&P stocks will continue to have a 15% stop loss, and the remainder will have a 20% stop. Franchise Picks are not intended to represent a recommended portfolio of stocks and is not sector based, but we may note where we believe a Pick falls within an investment style such as growth or value.
